title.narrative: COVID-19 Institute for youth development, KULT

description.narrative: New/additional funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 Youth CSOs play a key role in voicing youth priorites, needs and interests. The contribution aims at empowering youth and youth leaders for a more inclusive democratic process

Nya medel/medeltillägg för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Ungdomsorganisationer har en nyckelroll när det gäller att uttrycka och formulera ungdomars prioriteringar, behov och intressen. Insatsen syftar till att stärka ungdomar och ungdomsledare för en mer inkluderande demokratisk process.

tag.narrative: 8.5 - By 2030, achieve full and productive employment and decent work for all women and men, including for young people and persons with disabilities, and equal pay for work of equal value.

8.5 - Senast 2030 uppnå full och produktiv sysselsättning med anständiga arbetsvillkor för alla kvinnor och män, inklusive ungdomar och personer med funktionsnedsättning, samt lika lön för likvärdigt arbete.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Overview of the LFA and annual report: The LFA gives a quantifiable basis for monitoring all of the success indicators. The narrative report goes into detail on the successes. The baseline indicators are selected from the LFA below: Output 1.1. Passive youth mobilized and influence Target: 45 initiatives implemented in 45 local communities 2020+2019: 13 initiatives implemented in 12 local communities This indicator has not been performing as ambitiously as it was planned. KULT could have done more on the outreach. If there are limited quality applications, then perhaps some capacity building is necessary. Target: 75 youth leaders from 75 communities gain skills (both programs UMID and UMIDp) 2020+2019: Over 50 youth leaders and youth political leaders from over 50 local communities gained skills On the other had this indicator has been ambitiously implemented. Output 1.2 Local stakeholders greater respect for human rights Target 15 political initiatives implemented in at least 10 communities 2020+2019: 11 different local communities started off with political initiative on law on youth implementation Target: 75 young politicians gained skills, 50 youth officers gain skills 2020: 50 young politicians graduate and 93 youth officers graduate The narrative report highlights the following: Training participants (youth officers and youth activists) continue to come from all parts of BiH. In 2020 cycle of training: out of 56 applications 26 were selected (16 women, 10 men) from 19 communities. Most come from Federation BiH, with three from RS. The training for politicians is also reported by KULT as successful. At the impact level, during 2020, it is reported that 12 graduated trainees from the young politicians program were elected into local council and one participant was elected mayor. One of the participants was appointed Advisor on Civil Society in the Brcko District. At the output levels there were a total of 28 applications for the politicians programme in 2020. 23 participants from 8 political parties (SDA, DF, NiP, NS, HDZ, SNSD, etc) took part in the training, 6 of which were female. 8 of the 12 graduates were in the top 8 (very high on their party's lists) Alumni of UMID programs participants is key to future program sustainability (promotes networks and bonds between participants) The programs, "even without forefronting reconciliation, are building trust and allowing for connections between individuals and institutions, thus creating a climate where sustainable peace can flourish" The Entrepreneurial Fund for Youth is KULT's model of institutional establishment of support programs for young entrepreneurs and innovators in local communities in order to strengthen the economy in BiH and develop youth entrepreneurship. 40 businesses in 8 communities have been supported through Swedish support. During 2020 the focus was on monitoring and promotion of successful business as well as capacity building for municipalities in supporting youth to launch their businesses. Enteprenuership fund and the youth politician training component could include more women. KULT is needing to develop more gender transformative indicators and not only track gender disaggregated statistics. KULT has been working on Implementation of the Law on Volunteering, but mostly within the context of its public awareness component. This work has been limited to the Federation BiH. During 2020 KULT tested new online system for grant applications. It is designed to be interactive and can provide valuable feedback to KULT so as to improve the application process for future applicants. Conclusion of annual review meeting discussion (from Minutes of Meeting): -It would be beneficial if Embassy team can get more info how project implementation supported KULT internal development KULT is seen and understood as strategic partner to youth in BiH and strategic partner to Embassy for youth issues in BiH. -It would be beneficial for Embassy to understand better how both entities (FBiH and RS) and District Brcko are included in project, which components and how KULT makes bridges between youth across entities. -KULT can consider how to use experience and influence and effects of Covid-19 adjustments to future organizational and activity development, e.g. how current digitalization of specific components and activities can be used in future to boost up project results and still keep quality of work with beneficiaries (youth, youth organizations and decision makers). This means that KULT could use online tools for support to measures and aims that want to achieve. The project team stated that digitalization does not mean necessary substitution of methods but rather support to current in person activities. -It is necessary to understand more clear how Entrepreneurial component of the project is connected and supporting other components, thus supporting youth issues development and democratization of the BiH society. This component can have different activities in future to more support local (municipal) decision makers and bridge entrepreneurship funds to youth policy development. -Impact of education for youth political leaders is beneficial for different local and wider society process in BiH -Promotion of good practices and successful individual stories can support development of creation of critical mass of youth in BiH. More networking to other programs can be beneficial to future project implementation -Joint efforts of the Embassy and KULT toward decision makers can be supportive in change-making process and shifting the mindset
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
